title: Problem building on Gentoo
body:
by **peter.hans.froehlich**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. hg pull; hg update release to cb140bac9ab0 release.2009-11-12/release
2. cd src; ./all.bash
3.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

Install documentation says that the build should end with this:

--- cd ../test
N known bugs; 0 unexpected bugs

But I get the mess attached here instead (whole diff included at Ian's
request).

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?

GOARCH=amd64
GOOS=linux

Which revision are you sync'ed to?  (hg log -l 1)

changeset:   4021:3d43362ac8d4
tag:         tip
user:        Kevin Ballard <kevin@sb.org>
date:        Thu Nov 12 18:40:42 2009 -0800
summary:     Teach emacs M-x gofmt to save region/restrictions

Please provide any additional information below.

This is a Gentoo machine; uname -a says

Linux eggbert 2.6.27-gentoo-r7 #1 SMP Tue Jan 13 01:37:56 EST 2009 x86_64
AMD Athlon(tm) 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 6000+ AuthenticAMD GNU/Linux

Compiler and C library (at Ian's request):

sys-devel/gcc 4.3.4
sys-libs/glibc 2.9_p20081201-r2

Good luck! :-D
Attachments: 1. FILE (41461 bytes)
